whatMusicDoIListen.question: What music do you usually listen?
whatMusicDoIListen.answer: A bit of everythingâ€¦ If you access into my <1>Last.fm</1> profile, you will see what I usuaaly listen, but it's not everything.

whatAreYouDoingNow.question: What are you doing now?
whatAreYouDoingNow.answer: Working as programmer (and sometimes as devops?)...

whatOtherThingsDoYouLikeToDo.question: What other kind of things you like to do?
whatOtherThingsDoYouLikeToDo.answer: I like to make videos, and their editing. Blender (software to make three-dimensional modeling) and assemblies with it. Listen to music at all hours. Photography, when I can. Rides by bicycle, good and long journeys, when possible.

andWhatNot.question: And, what not?
andWhatNot.answer: Go running. Riding a motorbike. Nightclubs.

disqus.policy: This website uses <1>Disqus</1> as a comments system. We've disabled its functionality due to privaty reasons. If you want to use the system, you can by pressing the accept button, and doing this you accept the privacy policies of Disqus. If you don't want to, simply don't do anything.
disqus.terms: Take me to the terms and conditions, in addition to the privacy policies, of Disqus

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: mine or on those which I participated that has some relevance
projects.description: You can see all kinds of projects separated by categories, which you can try without any problem, as long as you have everything you need to run them

viz.title: Viz
viz.description: Drag here or search (with the button below) a compatible song with your browser and let the magic happen. It should go with any mp3 or wav. You can try with m4a (aac (<1>alac too, if you use Safari</1>)) or with ogg (vorbis). Recently flac also works.

experiments.title: Experiments
experiments.description: Odd experiments with web technologies which has been piled up here. Safety cannot be ensured...

eugl.title: Euclidean Space
eugl.description: Among algebraic studies, the crazy idea of the 'Euclidean Space' suddenly appeared as this funny representation of the 'Star Field' screensaver. You put yourself in it!
